neurorosettes.simulation

This module deals with the neuron structure and functions

Module Contents

Classes

Container

Represents the environment where neurons exist
class neurorosettes.simulation.Container(grid_range: List[float], simulation_2d: bool = True, contact_factory: neurorosettes.physics.ContactFactory = PotentialsFactory(), object_factory: neurorosettes.subcellular.ObjectFactory = ObjectFactory(), drag_coefficient: float = 10.0, density_check: Optional[neurorosettes.grid.CellDensityCheck] = None)

Represents the environment where neurons exist

register_neuron(self, neuron: neurorosettes.neurons.Neuron, color='red') → None

Registers a neuron and its representation into the container

update_drawings(self) → None

Updates the representations of the neurons

advance_cycles(self, time_step: float) → None
create_new_neuron(self, coordinates: Union[numpy.ndarray, List[float]], outgrowth_axis: Optional[Union[List[float], numpy.ndarray]] = None, differentiation_grade: int = 0, color='red') → neurorosettes.neurons.Neuron

Creates a new neuron and registers it to the container

differentiate(self) → None

Checks for neurons that are flagged for differentiation and deals with differentiation

kill(self) → None

Checks for neurons that are flagged for death and removes them from the container

divide(self) → None

Checks for neurons that are flagged for division and deals with division

get_displacement_from_force(self, force: numpy.ndarray, time_step: float) → numpy.ndarray

Returns a velocity from the passed force

move_cell(self, neuron: neurorosettes.neurons.Neuron, new_coordinates: Union[numpy.ndarray, List[float]]) → None

Moves the cell to a new position and updates the proximal point of the first neurite
